DOC.detailed_description: Acupuncture widely use patient seasonal allergic rhinitis ( SAR ) , although limited evidence effectiveness . The aims 3-armed , randomise control trial investigate whether acupuncture plus rescue medication non-inferior ( closed testing procedure : case success non-inferiority : test superiority ) minimal acupuncture plus rescue medication treatment SAR ( close test procedure : closed test procedure : case success non-inferiority : test superiority ) , whether acupuncture plus rescue medication non-inferior rescue medication alone consist oral antihistamine indication . The trial intervention perform approximately 40 outpatient centre Germany . In total , 400 patient SAR randomise one three group : acupuncture plus rescue medication , minimal acupuncture ( i.e . superficial needle non-acupuncture point ) plus rescue medication , rescue medication . Rescue medication consist oral antihistamine . Acupuncture minimal acupuncture administer physician specialised acupuncture consist 12 session per patient first 8 week . Patients rescue medication group receive 12 session acupuncture 8 week . The primary outcome measure mean Rhinitis Quality Life Questionnaire score ( RQLQ score week 6 8 first year ( adjusted baseline value ) Rescue Medication Score ( RMS ) week 6 8 first year ( adjusted baseline value ) .
